result.execSummary:
The defendant Lanelle M Shields was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (>2500-10,000g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Same conditions as probation except for conditions time.
Court is opposed to probation being transferred to Arizona immediately.  Probation may be transferred to Arizona after completing two years probation on this case, if deemed appropriate by agent.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, and assessments, to be paid within first 3 years of probation or serve 10 days in the HOC.   Defendant to make regular payments.
Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular payments.
Maintain full time employment, school, or a combination of both.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

No controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests.  Defendant should be tested at least once per month, and more often if agent deemed appropriate.
No contact with Co-defendant Aziz N.-A., in person or through a third party.
No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
AODA assessment, and compliance with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to be in some type of treatment.

Defendant pay restitution to reimburse Milwaukee County's District Attorney's office, for extradition costs in the amount of $1,530.  To be payable to Milwaukee County Treasures Office, and sent directly to the District Attorney's Office at 821 West State Street, Milwaukee, WI 53233.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means in favor of Milwaukee County.  Defendant to make regular payments.

timeConds.notes:
Consecutive to: UP FRONT CONDITION TIME CONSECUTIVE, in the House of Correction - with Huber for work, meeting with agent, community service, and treatment.  Court will allow release for elder care after serving 4 months up front first.  Court is opposed to electronic monitoring.  Defendant can be released up to 6 days per week.

REPORT IN DATE:  MONDAY, JULY 13, 2015 AT 8:00 AM.
If defendant fails to report, ALL COMMUNITY ACCESS IS CANCELED, and shall serve sentence STRAIGHT TIME, WITH NO RELEASE PRIVILEGES.
Complete 40 hours of community service each year at a non profit organization.  (160 hours total).

Consecutive to: IMPOSED and STAYED, CONSECUTIVE in the House of Correction to be used by the agent for any violations.  Defendant shall serve 10 days for the first violation, 20 days for the second violation, and 30 days for the third violation.  Defendant should then be revoked.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lanelle M Shields in court with attorney Christopher M. Glinski.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing Hearing continued.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS, with credit for 14 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  If defendant is revoked, same conditions apply to extended supervision as conditions of probation, except for the condition time.

The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 4 YEARS with the following conditions:  Court is opposed to probation being transferred to Arizona immediately.  Probation may be transferred to Arizona after completing two years probation on this case, if deemed appropriate by agent.

- Serve 10 MONTHS UP FRONT CONDITION TIME CONSECUTIVE, in the House of Correction - with huber for work, meeting with agent, community service, and treatment.  Court will allow release for elder care after serving 4 months up front first.  Court is opposed to electronic monitoring.  Defendant can be released up to 6 days per week.

                           REPORT IN DATE:  MONDAY, JULY 13, 2015 AT 8:00 AM.

If defendant fails to report, ALL COMMUNITY ACCESS IS CANCELED, and shall serve sentence STRAIGHT TIME, WITH NO RELEASE PRIVILEGES.


- 60 DAYS, IMPOSED and STAYED, CONSECUTIVE in the House of Correction to be used by the agent for any violations.  Defendant shall serve 10 days for the first violation, 20 days for the second violation, and 30 days for the third violation.  Defendant should then be revoked.
- AODA assessment, and compliance with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to be in some type of treatment.
- No controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests.  Defendant should be tested at least once per month, and more often if agent deemed appropriate.
- Maintain full time employment, school, or a combination of both.
- Complete 40 hours of community service each year at a non profit organization.  (160 hours total)
- No contact with Co-defendant Aziz N.-A., in person or through a third party.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, and assessments, to be paid within first 3 years of probation or serve 10 days in the HOC.   Defendant to make regular payments.
- Defendant pay restitution to reimburse Milwaukee County's District Attorney's office, for extradiction costs in the amount of $1,530.  To be payable to Milwaukee County Treasures Office, and sent directly to the District Attorney's Office at 821 West State Street, Milwaukee, WI 53233.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means in favor of Milwaukee County.  Defendant to make regular payments.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular payments.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Sentencing referral form;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.  aw

Defendant Lanelle M Shields in court with attorney Christopher M. Glinski.  Marissa Luz Santiago and Karl Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Case passed for lunch.  State to run NCIC on the defendant.  aw
Extradiction remimbursement information, received and filed.  aw
Letter from defendant's employment, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Lanelle M Shields in court with attorney Christopher M. Glinski.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 7/7/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3. 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Glinski informed the court that the defendant would like to resolve the case.  Case adjourned for plea hearing on 7/2/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw
Defendant's AMENDED witness list, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Lanelle M Shields in court with attorney Christopher M. Glinski.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case remains set for trial.  Defense witness would need counsel is she is called for trial.  State has previously withdrawn offer.  aw

Defendant Lanelle M Shields in court with attorney Christopher M. Glinski.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for final pretrial.  Attorney Glinski informs the court that his investigator has just spoken with the potential witness, and will turn over any statement to the state, if he will use it for trial.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 6/5/2015 at 11:00 am, branch 3.  All final pretrial documents are due on the next court date.  aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Lanelle M Shields in court with attorney Christopher M. Glinski.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense needs to do further investigations on a witness.  Court changes start of jury trial.  Parties are available.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 6/1/2015 at 8:30 am, and for jury trial on 7/7/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Jury trial scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lanelle M Shields in court with attorney Christopher M. Glinski.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for final pretrial.  Defense counsel requests to adjourn trial date to further investigate.  Defense may have exculpatory evidence written on sister's facebook page.  Court orders defendant to provide information to lawyer.  State does not object to the request to adjourn.  Court grants adjournment.  State puts on the record the offer that was made to the defendant, and withdraws offer as of today's date.  Case adjourned for status on 5/1/2015 at 8:30 am, and for jury trial on 7/8/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Jury trial scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lanelle M Shields in court with attorney Christopher M. Glinski.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for final pretrial.  Defense counsel informs the court that he had a breakdown in communication with the defendant, and requests to withdraw.  Court held colloquy with defendant to reasons why he wants defense counsel to withdraw.  Court orders defense counsel and defendant to put differences aside, and work together.  Court is not allowing attorney Glinski to withdraw.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 4/1/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's requested jury instructions received and filed.  aw
Defendant's Witness List, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Lanelle M Shields in court with attorney Christopher M. Glinski.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Negotiations ongoing.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 3/19/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State's Witness List, received and filed.  aw
State's motion in limine, received and filed.  aw
State's requested jury instructions received and filed.  aw

Defendant Lanelle M Shields in court with attorney Christopher M. Glinski.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed, and requests a trial date.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 3/18/2015 at 8:30 am, and for jury trial on 4/15/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  All final pretrial documents due next court date.   Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lanelle M Shields in court with attorney Christopher M. Glinski.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel may want to file a motion after reviewing evidence in person.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 1/29/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Defense counsel also to decide if he would like to file a daubert hearing, and court will address on next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lanelle M Shields in court with attorney Christopher M. Glinski.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 03.  Defense needs time to review discovery with the defendant.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lanelle M Shields in court with attorney Christopher M. Glinski.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Eugene Nagler, Detective for Milwaukee Police Department. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waived time limits for preliminary hearing.

Defendant Lanelle M Shields in court with attorney Christopher M. Glinski.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
State's witness is unavailable for today's proceedings. Defense witness does not object to an adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 11-03-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lanelle M Shields in court with attorney Christopher M. Glinski.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State informs Court that an essential witness who would testify at today's hearing had a medical emergency and is unable to appear in court on today's date.  State requests adjournment.  No objection by defense counsel.
Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE and adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Lanelle M Shields in court with attorney Cynthia M. Wynn.  Defendant Lanelle M Shields in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FIORENZA, Branch 3.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
